title: How to Draw the Parts of a Butterfly Life Cycle

steps.headline: Draw egg(s).
steps.description:
This is a simple design; draw something that looks like a bean or a small cylinder to serve as a butterfly's egg. Draw the egg situated on a leaf. Butterflies usually lay their eggs on specific plant leaves, such as the swan plant. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid3008858-v4-728px-Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Draw a text box. Inside of the text box, write egg. Then draw a line pointing to the picture of the egg. From this point, you'll shortly be able to draw a line to connect to the next picture.

steps.headline: Draw larva.
steps.description: Larva looks a bit like a worm. Thus, draw the larva in the shape of a worm. Draw it on a leaf, where it would usually be found. Draw a line pointing to the picture of larva(caterpillar) and label it larva. Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect it to the next picture.

steps.headline: Draw pupa.
steps.description: The pupa is a cocoon that the larva makes by shedding its skin. Draw the pupa (cocoon) hanging on a leaf. Draw a line pointing to the picture of the pupa and label it pupa. Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect to the last picture.

steps.headline: Draw the adult butterfly.
steps.description: Draw it sitting on a leaf, stem, flower or piece of fruit. Draw a line pointing to the picture and label it.

steps.headline: Color in each of the drawings as befits the type of butterfly you're using as the example.

text:
Draw egg(s). This is a simple design; draw something that looks like a bean or a small cylinder to serve as a butterfly's egg. Draw the egg situated on a leaf. From this point, you'll shortly be able to draw a line to connect to the next picture. Draw larva. Larva looks a bit like a worm. Thus, draw the larva in the shape of a worm. Draw it on a leaf, where it would usually be found. Draw a line pointing to the picture of larva(caterpillar) and label it larva. Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect it to the next picture. Draw pupa. The pupa is a cocoon that the larva makes by shedding its skin. Draw the pupa (cocoon) hanging on a leaf. Draw a line pointing to the picture of the pupa and label it pupa. Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect to the last picture. Draw the adult butterfly. Draw it sitting on a leaf, stem, flower or piece of fruit. Draw a line pointing to the picture and label it. Color in each of the drawings as befits the type of butterfly you're using as the example.
sentences: Draw egg(s).
This is a simple design; draw something that looks like a bean or a small cylinder to serve as a butterfly's egg.
Draw the egg situated on a leaf.
Butterflies usually lay their eggs on specific plant leaves, such as the swan plant.

{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/6\/66\/Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/aid3008858-v4-728px-Make-a-Drawing-That-Shows-Parts-of-a-Butterfly%27s-Life-Cycle-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Draw a text box.
Inside of the text box, write egg.
Then draw a line pointing to the picture of the egg.
From this point, you'll shortly be able to draw a line to connect to the next picture.
Draw larva.
Larva looks a bit like a worm.
Thus, draw the larva in the shape of a worm.
Draw it on a leaf, where it would usually be found.
Draw a line pointing to the picture of larva(caterpillar) and label it larva.
Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect it to the next picture.
Draw pupa.
The pupa is a cocoon that the larva makes by shedding its skin.
Draw the pupa (cocoon) hanging on a leaf.
Draw a line pointing to the picture of the pupa and label it pupa.
Shortly you'll be able to draw a line to connect to the last picture.
Draw the adult butterfly.
Draw it sitting on a leaf, stem, flower or piece of fruit.
Draw a line pointing to the picture and label it.
Color in each of the drawings as befits the type of butterfly you're using as the example.
